Exaggerate: The claim may exaggerate the extent to which "outside actors" dramatically changed election rules.
Understate: The claim may understate the impact of the changes made to election processes.
Lack enough support: The claim may lack sufficient evidence to support the assertion that outside actors dramatically changed the rules of the road.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that changes made to election processes by outside actors sowed distrust.
Exist alternative explanation: There may be alternative explanations for the changes made to election processes, such as court decisions or evolving circumstances.
